data.title: Office Space in Berlin
data.meta_description: In the green north of Berlin at the former Tegel Airport, attractive office space is being created as part of the lively, mixed neighborhood MyTegel.
data.text:
Tegel

Life and work

in Berlin Tegel

Project

Tegel

Future moves in

MyTegel is being built in the green north of Berlin between urban industrial and residential structures and charming nature not far from Lake Tegel. The new mixed-use urban quarter features flexible office space, attractive 1- to 5-room apartments, a daycare center and a spacious green courtyard. The buildings on the site have been awarded LEED Gold certification for green building and Wired Score Gold certification for digital connectivity. My Tegel is a livable, inspiring place to work, live and relax that combines diversity and quality of life with optimal types of use and short distances.

Open space design

GREEN SPACE

NATURE INSPIRED

The spacious MyTegel courtyard offers compensation and fresh air. The old tree population of black poplars, winter lime trees, Norway maples and sand birches will be supplemented with planting appropriate to the species, and the design will be improved with open spaces and play areas, seating and paths. The neighborhood square will become the central neighborhood meeting place.

BER Airport

Education

Shopping

After Work

Location

Hood

Central in the green

MyTegel is quietly located in one of the greenest parts of Berlin. After the closure of TXL Airport, Tegel is showing its full potential and, in addition to its extraordinary industrial history, diverse architecture and perfect connections to the city, offers above all a great deal of quality of life and recreation. In addition to numerous sports and recreational opportunities in Tegeler Forst, on Lake Tegel and along the Greenwich Promenade, attractive cultural and shopping experiences are available in and around the historic Borsighallen.

Locality

Short paths to diversity

Events at TXL

Research & Industrial Park

Tegel as a place of the future - many of the former airport buildings are available for interim use. Until they are redeveloped as an innovation park and residential district, the spaces will serve as impressive backdrops for events, concerts and exhibitions.

Tegel market hall

Local supply

Fresh for every day? For 100 years now, the recently modernized Markthalle Tegel has attracted discoverers and connoisseurs of regional and international products and services.

halls at the borsig tower

Shopping mall

Special shopping and recreational pleasures are offered by numerous retail outlets, cafés, restaurants, sports facilities and a cinema in the spacious, historic Borsighallen.

Humboldt Library

Media

The architecturally imposing Reinickendorf Central and University Library offers space for various cultural events in addition to an extensive range of analog and digital media.

CULINARY AT THE HARBOR

FOOD & DRINK

Maritime vacation flair in the middle of Berlin! The Greenwich Promenade invites you to stroll, jog or cycle. In numerous restaurants such as Fischermans, you can enjoy a deliciously relaxed evening after work.

AFTER WORK

WATER SPORTS ON LAKE TEGEL

With a total area of about 450 hectares, Lake Tegel is the second largest lake in Berlin and a paradise for wakeboarders, water ski fans and sailors. Excursions by paddle boat or steamer are also possible.
